intro: Pseudohydrosme buettneri, commonly known as the Hawaiian false hydrosme, is a rare and endemic plant species found exclusively in Hawaii. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often growing in rocky or forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species facing threats from habitat loss and invasive species. Conservation efforts are ongoing to protect and preserve this unique botanical treasure.
